intro: Ononis polyclada, commonly known as bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, pink or white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are lobed and hairy. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Botanically, it belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
